edu.stanford.math.plex
Class CRC

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.math.plex.CRC

public final class CRC
extends java.lang.Object

The CRC class provides good hash methods for int/long and string data.

Version:
$Id$

hash32

public static final int hash32(double[][] A,
                               int rows,
                               int cols)
Compute 32-bit CRC for a matrix of doubles. Used to compute a hash value for instances of Matrix.

Parameters:
A - The double[][].
rows - The length of A.
cols - The length of A[0].
Returns:
CRC hash of A.

hash64

public static final long hash64(long x,
                                long initial)
Easily testable function which computes 64-bit CRC for a single long.

These functions are only intended as entry points for test code. They are structurally the same as a some functions in a long-used and well-tested C library, so we were easily able to generate testcases for this code from the C code.

Parameters:
x - The long to be hashed.
initial - The CRC value to be updated.
Returns:
Long containing CRC hash value.

hash32

public static final int hash32(long x,
                               int initial)
Easily testable function which computes 32-bit CRC for a single long.

These functions are only intended as entry points for test code. They are structurally the same as a some functions in a long-used and well-tested C library, so we were easily able to generate testcases for this code from the C code.

Parameters:
x - The long to be hashed.
initial - The CRC value to be updated.
Returns:
Int containing CRC hash value.
